M_Tron_Hero_Kodiak,"2012-12-08T13:12:31.557Z","Bugs beware LEGO has up the ante on this one","
I really like this set, being a space theme kinda guy I was happy to see
LEGO bring space back.
Overall I gave it a five. Which I will break down as I rated the set.
• Building experience: 4. Building the set was really cool, LEGO has really up
their designs to incorporate things that AFOL's have been doing for many years.
The SNOT, side building and technic frame impressed me as soon as I saw the
first page of the instruction book. Very sturdy frame and base. There is even
some greebles.
• Parts: 5. There is a lot of new parts incorporated into this set, and some
good basic parts as well. Though the new parts and technic frame is what makes
me give it a 5.
• Mini fig parts. I was kind of disappointed that LEGO stayed away from air tanks
akin to the classic space lines. The robot armor and helmet (or head) is very
well done. And has many uses other than for the robot. The printing is nice as
well.
• Playability: 5. The multiple split function of this set is high, three ways
in fact. The Whole vehicle itself is a weapons platform, then the mech in the

back can deploy. The little buggy is nice if your minifig has to escape.
  • The large vehicle part: A transport for the mech and mobile lab. Works very
well.<span style=""mso-spacerun: yes

great! And a place to put the shield and gun for the robot on the mech is very

useful. Keeps things in its place.

has a few guns and computer for control.

across.<span style=""mso-spacerun: yes
well.<span style=""mso-spacerun: yes
column3: Plus the ability of the legs to move

column1: back and forth.<span style=""mso-spacerun: yes
looking at first, but sits well in his/her little vehicle.<span style=""mso-spacerun: yes

TheFadedTBCap,"2012-12-24T16:56:32.74Z","Amazing Space Set","The Vermin Vaporizer is an awesome addition to the LEGO Space line.&nbsp
column2: The parts included in this set are amazing for any collection including a lot of interesting sideways building elements. This set has a numerous amount of functions to operate.&nbsp
column3: The cockpit opens and the front door swings down to reveal a space buggy for an escape or sneak attack.&nbsp
column4: Also the turret on the back becomes a mech.&nbsp
column5: So, basically, you're getting three machines in one set.&nbsp
column6: Also, the little bug machine is well built and provides good maneuverability.&nbsp
column7: We'll start with the big one.&nbsp
column8: It is built on a strong, light-wieght technic frame which can take a beating.&nbsp
column9: The whole machine has two flick fire missile behind the cockpit and two more on the turret.&nbsp
column10: It has two side guns that are well designed and look powerful.&nbsp
column11: There is a laboratory in the back for studying a cocoon, the bugs method of capturing minifigures.&nbsp
column12: The whole machine has a very nice look with a great use of side-ways building.&nbsp
column13: The small car has two small guns.&nbsp
column14: It looks good and has some cool elements.&nbsp
column15: The mech might be my favorite part.&nbsp
column16: For a small mech, the LEGO Group did a nice job on adding a lot of maneuverability.&nbsp
column17: The guns are fantastic and have two flick fire missiles.&nbsp
column18: The arms also provide a place to hold the robot's gun and shield.&nbsp
column19: The cockpit is roomy, well built, and looks amazing and the antenna adds an nice touch.&nbsp
column20: The legs give some great movement and give the option of like toe/stabilizer things. &nbsp
column21: The enemy vehicle tail and legs have a wide range of motion and the vehicle comes with two flick fire missiles.&nbsp
column22: The minifigures in this set are amazing!&nbsp
column23: The green spaceman face is double sided with tan facial hair and some cut marks on one side and a cool breathing device on the other.&nbsp
column24: His body and legs look tough and has a great sci-fi look with a green accent.&nbsp
column25: The robot has a great looking head and body.&nbsp
column26: His armor is very nice and tough-looking.&nbsp
column27: I love the robots gun and shield, they are just have amazing details.&nbsp
column28: The bug-man is amazing too with a cool ""exoskeleton"" look.&nbsp
column29: His head has some great detail and looks fascinating.&nbsp
column30:
He comes with a space blaster.

Pros:
Amazing tank vehicle that breaks into multiple vehicles
Awesome mech with cool guns and great maneuverability
Nice small car
Great enemy machine
Comes with a cocoon
Laboratory in the back of car
Multiple flick fire missiles
Well built and sturdy
Cool new elements

Cons:
Lots of clear stickers became a burden while building

Overall, I give it a 10/10!
column31: I looking forward to more Galaxy Squad sets if they are as good as this one.&nbsp
column32:
I recommend this set to anyone.
",TRUE,5,5,5,5,4

column1: Blockland,"2012-12-30T16:51:09.21Z","Almost Perfect","
column5: I recently walked to my local Lego store, hoping to obtain the 2013 Star Wars sets early. When I asked the manager, he said the sets lasted a noble 2 seconds. I was about to walk out, but this set caught my eye. It was even stranger because it was on sale. I rushed to the check out line and bought it for a good 50 dollars. I soon built it and I am impressed. At first, I thought this would be a failed theme, however, my opinion has changed quite a bit. If the other sets in the series are as good as this one, this could be a long lasting theme. Now, onto the set. It has 3 minifigs,&nbsp
column6: 4 separate vehicles, and loads of play features. The main vehicle, the Vermin Vaporizer is a perfect mobile vehicle with the juggernaut wheels and a nice exit door. The mech is possibly my favorite mech since Exo-Force. It really was able to stand and had an overall great design. However, where have I seen this vehicle, Metal Slug 5 anyone? Next is the moon buggy, which is alright, but could be better.&nbsp
column7: The last one, and probably least, is the bug scorpian. It does have a nice design, however, its more of a battlepack vehicle. I do love the golden lightsaber handle though. The minifigs were also perfect, expecially the robot. The bug is very cool, however, why is there a Metapod on his head, lol. The captain was very nice and really made you want more. The robot is by far the best minifig in a long while, as the detail was amazing, not to say, it reminded me of Probotector. The weapons were also nice, even though I pondered why there were Lego energy swords. There is one thing that downfalls this set however. There is way too many stickers.

column1: Pros

• Amazing figures, expecially the robot
  • Good price
  • Lots of playability value
  • Some good extra pieces
  • Interesting concept
Cons

• Too many stickers
  • the buggy could be better
  • I swear the instructions were messed up

I suggest you buy it quickly, you wont regret it.
